sentence.value: Vladimir Aleksandrovich Shatalov (Russian: ???????? ????????????? ???????; born December 8, 1927 in Petropavlovsk) is a former Soviet cosmonaut who flew three space missions of the Soyuz programme: Soyuz 4, Soyuz 8, and Soyuz 10.

sentence.value: From 1971 to 1987 he was Commander of Cosmonaut Training, and Director of the Cosmonaut Training Centre from then until 1991.
sentence.annotated-sentence: From [[1971|1971_(film)]] to [[1987|1987]] he was [[Commander|Commander]] of Cosmonaut [[Training|Training]], and Director of the Cosmonaut [[Training Centre|Training]] from then until [[1991|1991]].

sentence.value: Quote: "When we look into the sky it seems to us to be endless.

sentence.value: We breathe without thinking about it, as is natural... and then you sit aboard a spacecraft, you tear away from Earth, and within ten minutes you have been carried straight through the layer of air, and beyond there is nothing!
sentence.tree: nsubj(breathe/VBP-2,We/PRP-1) prepc_without(breathe/VBP-2,thinking/VBG-4) prep_about(thinking/VBG-4,it/PRP-6) advmod(natural/JJ-10,as/RB-8) cop(natural/JJ-10,is/VBZ-9) ccomp(breathe/VBP-2,natural/JJ-10) advmod(sit/VBP-15,then/RB-13) nsubj(sit/VBP-15,you/PRP-14) conj_and(breathe/VBP-2,sit/VBP-15) det(spacecraft/NN-18,a/DT-17) prep_aboard(sit/VBP-15,spacecraft/NN-18) nsubj(tear/VBP-21,you/PRP-20) ccomp(breathe/VBP-2,tear/VBP-21) prep_away_from(tear/VBP-21,Earth/NNP-24) num(minutes/NNS-29,ten/CD-28) prep_within(carried/VBN-33,minutes/NNS-29) nsubjpass(carried/VBN-33,you/PRP-30) nsubjpass(carried/VBN-33,you/PRP-30) aux(carried/VBN-33,have/VBP-31) auxpass(carried/VBN-33,been/VBN-32) conj_and(breathe/VBP-2,carried/VBN-33) conj_and(breathe/VBP-2,carried/VBN-33) conj_and(carried/VBN-33,carried/VBN-33) advmod(carried/VBN-33,straight/RB-34) det(layer/NN-37,the/DT-36) prep_through(carried/VBN-33,layer/NN-37) prep_of(layer/NN-37,air/NN-39) expl(is/VBZ-44,there/EX-43) prepc_beyond(carried/VBN-33,is/VBZ-44) nsubj(is/VBZ-44,nothing/NN-45)

sentence.value: The 'boundless' blue sky, the ocean which gives us breath and protects us from endless black and death, is but an infinitesimally thin film.
sentence.annotated-sentence: The 'boundless' blue sky, [[the ocean|Ocean]] which gives us breath and protects us from endless black and [[death|Death]], is but an infinitesimally [[thin film|Thin_film]].
sentence.pattern_crowdsource: The 'boundless' blue sky, the ocean which gives us breath and protects us from endless black and death, is but an infinitesimally thin film.

sentence.value: How dangerous it is to threaten even the smallest part of this gossamer covering, this conserver of life."
